dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe following options are listed for command line use, but can also be used when running Ganache programmatically in your project.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"Chain:\n  --chain.allowUnlimitedContractSize    Allows unlimited contract sizes while debugging. Setting this to true\n                                        will cause ganache to behave differently than production environments.\n                                                                                    [boolean] [default: false]\n\n  --chain.allowUnlimitedInitCodeSize    Allows unlimited initcode sizes while debugging. Setting this to true\n                                        will cause ganache to behave differently than production environments.\n                                                                                    [boolean] [default: false]\n\n  --chain.asyncRequestProcessing        When set to false only one request will be processed at a time.\n                                                                                     [boolean] [default: true]\n\n  --chain.chainId                       The currently configured chain id.            [number] [default: 1337]\n\n  -i, --chain.networkId                 The id of the network returned by the RPC method net_version.\n                                        deprecated aliases: --networkId\n                                                            [number] [default: System time at process start or\n                                                               Network ID of forked blockchain if configured.]\n\n  -t, --chain.time                      Date that the first block should start.\n                                        deprecated aliases: --time                                    [number]\n\n  -k, --chain.hardfork                  Set the hardfork rules for the EVM.\n                                        deprecated aliases: --hardfork\n          [string] [choices: \u0026quot;constantinople\u0026quot;, \u0026quot;byzantium\u0026quot;, \u0026quot;petersburg\u0026quot;, \u0026quot;istanbul\u0026quot;, \u0026quot;muirGlacier\u0026quot;, \u0026quot;berlin\u0026quot;,\n                           \u0026quot;london\u0026quot;, \u0026quot;arrowGlacier\u0026quot;, \u0026quot;grayGlacier\u0026quot;, \u0026quot;merge\u0026quot;, \u0026quot;shanghai\u0026quot;] [default: \u0026quot;shanghai\u0026quot;]\n\n  --chain.vmErrorsOnRPCResponse         Whether to report runtime errors from EVM code as RPC errors.\n                                                                                    [boolean] [default: false]\n\n\nDatabase:\n  --database.dbPath                     Specify a path to a directory to save the chain database.\n                                        deprecated aliases: --db, --db_path                           [string]\n\nLogging:\n  --logging.debug                       Set to true to log EVM opcodes.             [boolean] [default: false]\n\n  -q, --logging.quiet                   Set to true to disable logging.\n                                        deprecated aliases: --quiet                 [boolean] [default: false]\n\n  -v, --logging.verbose                 Set to true to log detailed RPC requests.\n                                        deprecated aliases: --verbose               [boolean] [default: false]\n\n\nMiner:\n  -b, --miner.blockTime                 Sets the blockTime in seconds for automatic mining. A blockTime of 0\n                                        enables \u0026quot;instamine mode\u0026quot;, where new executable transactions will be\n                                        mined instantly.\n                                        deprecated aliases: --blockTime                  [number] [default: 0]\n\n  -g, --miner.defaultGasPrice           Sets the default gas price in WEI for transactions if not otherwise\n                                        specified.\n                                        deprecated aliases: --gasPrice          [string] [default: 0x77359400]\n\n  -l, --miner.blockGasLimit             Sets the block gas limit in WEI.\n                                        deprecated aliases: --gasLimit            [string] [default: 0xb71b00]\n\n  --miner.defaultTransactionGasLimit    Sets the default transaction gas limit in WEI. Set to \u0026quot;estimate\u0026quot; to\n                                        use an estimate (slows down transaction execution by 40%+).\n                                                                                   [string] [default: 0x15f90]\n\n  --miner.difficulty                    Sets the block difficulty.                     [string] [default: 0x1]\n\n  --miner.callGasLimit                  Sets the transaction gas limit in WEI for eth_call and eth_estimateGas\n                                        calls.\n                                                                                 [string] [default: 0x2faf080]\n  --miner.instamine                     Set the instamine mode to either \u0026quot;eager\u0026quot; (default) or \u0026quot;strict\u0026quot;. In\n                                        \u0026quot;eager\u0026quot; mode a transaction will be included in a block before its hash\n                                        is returned to the caller. In \u0026quot;strict\u0026quot; mode a transaction's hash is\n                                        returned to the caller before the transaction is included in a block.\n                                        This value has no effect if `blockTime` is *not* `0` (the default).`\n                                                      [string] [choices: \u0026quot;eager\u0026quot;, \u0026quot;strict\u0026quot;] [default: \u0026quot;eager\u0026quot;]\n\n  --miner.coinbase                      Sets the address where mining rewards will go.\n                                                         [default: 0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000000]\n\n  --miner.extraData                     Set the extraData block header field a miner can include.\n                                                                                        [string] [default: 0x]\n\n  --miner.priceBump                     Minimum price bump percentage needed to replace a transaction that\n                                        already exists in the transaction pool.         [string] [default: 10]\n\n\nWallet:\n  --wallet.accounts                     Account data in the form \u0026lt;private_key\u0026gt;,\u0026lt;initial_balance\u0026gt;, can be\n                                        specified multiple times. Note that private keys are 64 characters\n                                        long and must be entered as an 0x-prefixed hex string. Balance can\n                                        either be input as an integer, or as a 0x-prefixed hex string with\n                                        either form specifying the initial balance in wei.\n                                        deprecated aliases: --account                                  [array]\n\n  -a, --wallet.totalAccounts            Number of accounts to generate at startup.\n                                        deprecated aliases: --accounts                  [number] [default: 10]\n\n  -d, --wallet.deterministic            Use pre-defined, deterministic seed.\n                                        deprecated aliases: --deterministic         [boolean] [default: false]\n\n  -s, --wallet.seed                     Seed to use to generate a mnemonic.\n                                        deprecated aliases: --seed\n                                                                                                      [string]\n                                             [default: Random value, unless wallet.deterministic is specified]\n\n  -m, --wallet.mnemonic                 Use a specific HD wallet mnemonic to generate initial addresses.\n                                        deprecated aliases: --mnemonic                                [string]\n                                                                         [default: Generated from wallet.seed]\n\n  -u, --wallet.unlockedAccounts         Array of addresses or address indexes specifying which accounts should\n                                        be unlocked.\n                                        deprecated aliases: --unlock                                   [array]\n\n  -n, --wallet.lock                     Lock available accounts by default (good for third party transaction\n                                        signing).\n                                        deprecated aliases: --secure, --lock        [boolean] [default: false]\n\n  --wallet.passphrase                   Passphrase to use when locking accounts.\n                                        deprecated aliases: --passphrase                              [string]\n\n  --wallet.accountKeysPath              Specifies a file to save accounts and private keys to, for testing.\n                                        deprecated aliases: --account_keys_path, --acctKeys           [string]\n\n  -e, --wallet.defaultBalance           The default account balance, specified in ether.\n                                        deprecated aliases: --defaultBalanceEther     [number] [default: 1000]\n\n  --wallet.hdPath                       The hierarchical deterministic path to use when generating accounts.\n                                                                            [string] [default: m,44',60',0',0]\n\n\nFork:\n  -f, --fork.url                        Fork from another currently running Ethereum client at a given block.\n                                        Input should be the URL of the node, e.g. \u0026quot;http://localhost:1337\u0026quot;. You\n                                        can optionally specify the block to fork from using an @ sign:\n                                        \u0026quot;http://localhost:1337@8675309\u0026quot;.\n\n                                        You can specify Basic Authentication credentials in the URL as well.\n                                        e.g., \u0026quot;wss://user:password@example.com/\u0026quot;. If you need to use an Infura\n                                        Project Secret, you would use it like this:\n                                        \u0026quot;wss://:{YOUR-PROJECT-SECRET}@mainnet.infura.com/...\u0026quot;\n\n                                        Alternatively, you can use the fork.username and fork.password\n                                        options.\n                                        deprecated aliases: --fork\n\n  --fork.network                        A network name to fork from; uses Infura's archive nodes.\n\n                                        Use the shorthand command ganache --fork to automatically fork from\n                                        Mainnet at the latest block.\n                                                            [choices: \u0026quot;mainnet\u0026quot;, \u0026quot;goerli\u0026quot;, \u0026quot;görli\u0026quot;, \u0026quot;sepolia\u0026quot;]\n  --fork.blockNumber                    Block number the provider should fork from.\n                                                                                [default: Latest block number]\n\n  --fork.preLatestConfirmations         When the fork.blockNumber is set to \u0026quot;latest\u0026quot; (default), the number of\n                                        blocks before the remote node's \u0026quot;latest\u0026quot; block to fork from.\n                                                                                         [number] [default: 5]\n\n  --fork.username                       Username to use for Basic Authentication. Does not require setting\n                                        fork.password.\n\n                                        When combined with fork.password, is shorthand for fork: { headers: {\n                                        \u0026quot;Authorization\u0026quot;: \u0026quot;Basic {ENCODED-BASIC-HEADER}\u0026quot; } }\n\n                                        If the fork.headers option specifies an \u0026quot;Authorization\u0026quot; header, it\n                                        will be be inserted after this Basic token.\n\n  --fork.password                       Password to use for Basic Authentication. Does not require setting\n                                        fork.username.\n\n                                        When combined with fork.username, is shorthand for fork: { headers: {\n                                        \u0026quot;Authorization\u0026quot;: \u0026quot;Basic {ENCODED-BASIC-HEADER}\u0026quot; } }\n\n                                        If the fork.headers option specifies an \u0026quot;Authorization\u0026quot; header, it\n                                        will be be inserted after this Basic token.\n\n  --fork.jwt                            Encoded JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authenticating to some servers.\n\n                                        Shorthand for fork:\n                                          { headers: { \u0026quot;Authorization\u0026quot;: \u0026quot;Bearer {YOUR-ENCODED-JWT}\u0026quot; } }\n\n                                        If the fork.headers option specifies an \u0026quot;Authorization\u0026quot; header, it\n                                        will be be inserted after the JWT Bearer token.\n\n  --fork.userAgent                      The User-Agent header sent to the fork on each request.\n\n                                        Sent as Api-User-Agent when used in the browser.\n\n                                        Will be overridden by a \u0026quot;User-Agent\u0026quot; defined in the fork.headers\n                                        option, if provided.\n\n                                                                                [default: Ganache/7.0.0-beta.0\n                                          (https://www.trufflesuite.com/ganache; ganache\u0026lt;at\u0026gt;trufflesuite.com)]\n\n  --fork.origin                         The Origin header sent to the fork on each request.\n\n                                        Ignored in the browser.\n\n                                        Will be overridden by an \u0026quot;Origin\u0026quot; value defined in the fork.headers\n                                        option, if provided.\n\n  --fork.headers                        Headers to supply on each request to the forked provider.\n\n                                        Headers set here override headers set by other options, unless\n                                        otherwise specified.\n\n                                                                    Defaults to: [\u0026quot;User-Agent: Ganache/VERSION\n                                         (https://www.trufflesuite.com/ganache; ganache\u0026lt;at\u0026gt;trufflesuite.com)\u0026quot;]\n                                                                                                       [array]\n\n  --fork.requestsPerSecond              Restrict the number of requests per second sent to the fork provider.\n                                        0 means no limit is applied.                     [number] [default: 0]\n\n  --fork.disableCache                   Disables caching of all forking requests. (along with any valid combination\nof the Ganache startup arguments above):\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"  -D, --detach, --😈                     Run Ganache in detached (daemon) mode.                       [boolean]\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e  -D, --detach, --😈                     Run Ganache in detached (daemon) mode.                       [boolean]\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThis will start Ganache as a background process, and return to the console as soon as Ganache has started and is ready to\nreceive requests. A friendly name will be returned to STDOUT which can then be used to interact with the instance via\nthe \u003ccode\u003eganache instances\u003c/code\u003e command with the following arguments:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"Commands:\n  ganache instances list         List instances running in detached mode\n  ganache instances stop \u0026lt;name\u0026gt;  Stop the instance specified by \u0026lt;name\u0026gt;\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003eCommands:\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e  ganache instances list         List instances running in detached mode\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e  ganache instances stop \u0026lt;name\u0026gt;  Stop the instance specified by \u0026lt;name\u0026gt;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eE.g., start Ganache on port 8544, with a block time of 10 seconds, and then stop the instance.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"$ ganache --port=8544 --miner.blockTime=10 --detach\nsalted_caramel_ganache\n\n$ ganache instances │\n└───────┴────────────────────────┴──────────┴─────────┴────────────────┴────────┘\n\n$ ganache instances stop salted_caramel_ganache\nProcess stopped\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e$ \u003cspan dir=\"auto\"\u003eIn addition to \u003ca href=\"https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1193\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eEIP-1193's\u003c/a\u003e \u003ccode\u003e\"message\"\u003c/code\u003e event and the legacy \u003ccode\u003e\"data\"\u003c/code\u003e event, Ganache emits 4 additional events: \u003ccode\u003e\"ganache:vm:tx:before\"\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003e\"ganache:vm:tx:step\"\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003e\"ganache:vm:tx:after\"\u003c/code\u003e, and \u003ccode\u003e\"ganache:vm:tx:console.log\"\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThese events can be used to observe the lifecycle of any transaction executed via \u003ccode\u003e*sendTransaction\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eeth_call\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003edebug_traceTransaction\u003c/code\u003e, or \u003ccode\u003edebug_storageRangeAt\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThese share the \u003ca href=\"https://www.trufflesuite.com/docs/truffle/advanced/event-system#how-to-define-your-event-handlers\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eevent paradigm that Truffle uses\u003c/a\u003e, but without any of the wildcard handling, i.e., no \u003ccode\u003e\"vm:*\"\u003c/code\u003e support (for now).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eEach of these events will emit a \u003ccode\u003econtext\u003c/code\u003e object which is a unique object that can be used to identify a transaction over the course of its lifecycle. For example:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-ts notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"interface StepEvent {\n  account: {\n    nonce: bigint;\n    balance: bigint;\n    stateRoot: Buffer;\n    codeHash: Buffer;\n  };\n  address: Buffer;\n  codeAddress: Buffer;\n  depth: number;\n  gasLeft: bigint;\n  gasRefund: bigint;\n  memory: Buffer;\n  memoryWordCount: bigint;\n  opcode: {\n    name: string;\n    fee: number;\n  };\n  pc: number;\n  returnStack: Buffer[];\n  stack: Buffer[];\n}\n\nconst contexts = new Map();\nprovider.on(\u0026quot;ganache:vm:tx:before\u0026quot;, (event: { context: {} }) =\u0026gt; {\n  contexts.set(event.context, []);\n});\nprovider.on(\u0026quot;ganache:vm:tx:step\u0026quot;, (event: { context: {}; data: StepEvent }) =\u0026gt; {\n  contexts.get(event.context).push(event.data);\n});\nprovider.on(\n  \u0026quot;ganache:vm:tx:console.log\u0026quot;,\n  (event: { context: {}; logs: (string | bigint | boolean)[] }) =\u0026gt; {\n    console.log(...event.logs);\n  }\n);\nprovider.on(\u0026quot;ganache:vm:tx:after\u0026quot;, (event: { context: {} }) =\u0026gt; {\n  doAThingWithThisTransactionsSteps(contexts.get(event.context));\n  contexts.delete(event.context);\n});\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003einterface\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-smi\"\u003eStepEvent\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003eaccount\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e\n    \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003enonce\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-smi\"\u003ebigint\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e;\u003c/span\u003e\n    \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003ebalance\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-smi\"\u003ebigint\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e;\u003c/span\u003e\n    \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003econtext\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e;\u003c/span\u003e\n  \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003econtexts\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003edelete\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eevent\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003econtext\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e;\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e}\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe reason this \u003ccode\u003econtext\u003c/code\u003e is necessary is that Ganache may run multiple transactions simultaneously, so \u003ccode\u003e\"ganache:vm:tx:step\"\u003c/code\u003e events from different transactions could be intermingled.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe above events will be emitted for \u003ccode\u003eeth_call\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003e*sendTransaction\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003edebug_traceTransaction\u003c/code\u003e, and \u003ccode\u003edebug_storageRangeAt\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eCurrently, we do not await the event listener's return value, however, we'll likely enable this in the trufflesuite/ganache:latest\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTo pass options to Ganache through Docker simply add the arguments to the end of the run command, e.g.,\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"$ docker run --detach --publish 8545:8545 trufflesuite/ganache:latest --accounts 10 --debug\n                                                                      ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e$ \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003edocker run --detach --publish 8545:8545 trufflesuite/ganache:latest --accounts 10 --debug\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e                                                                      ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe Docker container adds an environment variable \u003ccode\u003eDOCKER=true\u003c/code\u003e; when this variable is set to \u003ccode\u003etrue\u003c/code\u003e (case insensitive), Ganache uses a default hostname IP of \u003ccode\u003e0.0.0.0\u003c/code\u003e instead of the normal default \u003ccode\u003e127.0.0.1\u003c/code\u003e. You can still specify a custom hostname however:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"$ docker run --detach --publish 8545:8545 trufflesuite/ganache:latest --host XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX\n                                                                      ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e$ \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003edocker run --detach --publish 8545:8545 trufflesuite/ganache:latest --host XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e                                                                      ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTo build and run the Docker container from source:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"$ git clone https://github.com/trufflesuite/ganache.git \u0026amp;\u0026amp; cd ganache\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e$ \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003egit clone https://github.com/trufflesuite/ganache.git \u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003e\u0026amp;\u0026amp;\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003ecd\u003c/span\u003e ganache\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003ethen:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Ganache is an Ethereum simulator that makes developing Ethereum applications faster, easier, and safer. It includes all popular RPC functions and features (like events) and can be run deterministically to make development a breeze.</p><ul dir="auto"><li><code>console.log</code> in Solidity</li><li>Zero-config Mainnet Forking</li><li>Fork any Ethereum network without waiting to sync</li><li>Ethereum JSON-RPC support</li><li>Snapshot/revert state</li><li>Mine blocks instantly, on demand, or at an interval</li><li>Fast-forward time</li><li>Impersonate any account (no private keys required!)</li><li>Listens for JSON-RPC 2.0 requests over HTTP/WebSockets</li><li>Programmatic use in Node.js</li><li>Pending Transactions</li><li><a href="https://github.com/trufflesuite/ganache/tree/develop/packages/flavor#readme">Flavors</a> (aka Plugins), like <a href="https://github.com/trufflesuite/ganache-plugin-filecoin/tree/main/packages/filecoin#readme">Filecoin</a></li></ul><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Getting Started</h2><a id="user-content-getting-started" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Getting Started" href="#getting-started"><svg class="octicon via Node.js, or <a href="#browser-use">in the browser</a>.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Command line use</h3><a id="user-content-command-line-use" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Command line use" href="#command-line-use"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">You must first install <a href="https://nodejs.org/" rel="nofollow">Node.js</a> >= v16.0.0 and npm >= 7.10.0.</p><p dir="auto">To install Ganache globally, run:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ npm install ganache --global"><pre>$ <span class="pl-s1">npm install ganache --global</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">In case you're upgrading from a previous version of Ganache, we've also written up <a href="https://github.com/trufflesuite/ganache/blob/develop/UPGRADE-GUIDE.md">this handy guide</a> on how to upgrade/install Ganache and to document all breaking changes to look out for.</p><p dir="auto">Once installed globally, you can start ganache right from your command line:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="ganache"><pre><span class="pl-c1">ganache</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Your output should look something like this:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content <code>database</code>, <code>fork</code>, <code>logging</code>, <code>miner</code>, <code>wallet</code>, and <code>server</code> namespaces, and should be used as such on startup, i.e.</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="ganache --namespace.option="value""><pre><span class="pl-c1">ganache --namespace.option="value"</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">for CLI use, and</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-ts notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="const options = { namespace: { option: "value"}};const provider = ganache.provider(options);"><pre><span class="pl-k">const</span> <span class="pl-s1">options</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-c1">namespace</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-c1">option</span>: <span class="pl-s">"value"</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span><span class="pl-k">const</span> <span class="pl-s1">provider</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s1">ganache</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">provider</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">options</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">for programmatic use.</p><p dir="auto">The following options are listed for command line use, but can also be used when Does not require setting</span><span class="pl-c1">                                        fork.password.</span><span class="pl-c1">                                        When combined with fork.password, is shorthand for fork: { headers: {</span><span class="pl-c1">                                        "Authorization": "Basic {ENCODED-BASIC-HEADER}" } }</span><span class="pl-c1">                                        If the fork.headers option specifies an "Authorization" header, it</span><span class="pl-c1">                                        will be be inserted after this Basic token.</span><span class="pl-c1">  --fork.password                       Password to use for Basic Authentication. Does not require setting</span><span class="pl-c1">                                        fork.username.</span><span class="pl-c1">                                        When combined with fork.username, is shorthand for fork: { headers: {</span><span class="pl-c1">                                        "Authorization": "Basic {ENCODED-BASIC-HEADER}" } }</span><span class="pl-c1">                                        If the fork.headers option specifies an "Authorization" header, it</span><span class="pl-c1">                                        will be be inserted after this Basic token.</span><span class="pl-c1">  --fork.jwt                            Encoded JSON Web Token (JWT) used for authenticating to some servers.</span><span class="pl-c1">                                        Shorthand for fork:</span><span class="pl-c1">                                          { headers: { "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR-ENCODED-JWT}" } }</span><span class="pl-c1">                                        If the fork.headers option specifies an "Authorization" header, it</span><span class="pl-c1">                                        will be be inserted after the JWT Bearer token.</span><span class="pl-c1">  --fork.userAgent                      The User-Agent header sent to the fork on each request.</span><span class="pl-c1">                                        Sent as Api-User-Agent when used in the browser.</span><span class="pl-c1">                                        Will be overridden by a "User-Agent" defined in the fork.headers</span><span class="pl-c1">                                        option, if provided.</span><span class="pl-c1">                                                                                [default: Ganache/7.0.0-beta.0</span><span class="pl-c1">                                          (https://www.trufflesuite.com/ganache; ganache<at>trufflesuite.com)]</span><span class="pl-c1">  --fork.origin                         The Origin header sent to the fork on each request.</span><span class="pl-c1">                                        Ignored in the browser.</span><span class="pl-c1">                                        Will be overridden by an "Origin" value defined in the fork.headers</span><span class="pl-c1">                                        option, if provided.</span><span class="pl-c1">  --fork.headers                        Headers to supply on each request to the forked provider.</span><span class="pl-c1">                                        Headers set here override headers set by other options, unless</span><span class="pl-c1">                                        otherwise specified.</span><span class="pl-c1">                                                                    Defaults to: ["User-Agent: Ganache/VERSION</span><span class="pl-c1">                                         (https://www.trufflesuite.com/ganache; ganache<at>trufflesuite.com)"]</span><span class="pl-c1">                                                                                                       [array]</span><span class="pl-c1">  --fork.requestsPerSecond              Restrict the number of requests per second sent to the fork provider.</span><span class="pl-c1">                                        0 means no limit is applied. dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Detached Instances</h3><a id="user-content-detached-instances" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Detached Instances" the following argument (along with any valid combinationof the Ganache startup arguments above):</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="  -D, --detach, --😈                     Run Ganache in detached (daemon) mode.                       [boolean]"><pre><span class="pl-c1">  -D, --detach, --😈                     Run Ganache in detached (daemon) mode.                       [boolean]</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">This will start Ganache as a background process, and return to the console as soon as Ganache has started and is ready toreceive requests. A friendly name will be returned to STDOUT which can then be used to interact with the instance viathe <code>ganache instances</code> command with the following arguments:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="Commands:  ganache instances list         List instances running in detached mode  ganache instances stop <name>  Stop the instance specified by <name>"><pre><span class="pl-c1">Commands:</span><span class="pl-c1">  ganache instances list         List instances running in detached mode</span><span class="pl-c1">  ganache instances stop <name>  Stop the instance specified by <name></span></pre></div><p dir="auto">E.g., start Ganache on port 8544, with a block time of 10 seconds, and then stop the instance.</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ ganache --port=8544 --miner.blockTime=10 --detachsalted_caramel_ganache$ ganache instances list┌───────┬────────────────────────┬──────────┬─────────┬────────────────┬────────┐│   PID │ Name                   │ Flavor   │ Version │ Host           │ Uptime │├───────┼────────────────────────┼──────────┼─────────┼────────────────┼────────┤│ 12182 │ salted_caramel_ganache │ ethereum │ 7.6.0   │ 127.0.0.1:8545 │    36s │└───────┴────────────────────────┴──────────┴─────────┴────────────────┴────────┘$ ganache instances stop salted_caramel_ganacheProcess stopped"><pre>$ <span class="pl-s1">ganache --port=8544 --miner.blockTime=10 --detach</span><span class="pl-c1">salted_caramel_ganache</span>$ <span class="pl-s1">ganache instances list</span><span class="pl-c1">┌───────┬────────────────────────┬──────────┬─────────┬────────────────┬────────┐</span><span class="pl-c1">│   PID │ Name                   │ Flavor   │ Version │ Host           │ Uptime │</span><span class="pl-c1">├───────┼────────────────────────┼──────────┼─────────┼────────────────┼────────┤</span><span class="pl-c1">│ 12182 │ salted_caramel_ganache │ ethereum │ 7.6.0   │ 127.0.0.1:8545 │    36s │</span><span class="pl-c1">└───────┴────────────────────────┴──────────┴─────────┴────────────────┴────────┘</span>$ <span class="pl-s1">ganache instances stop salted_caramel_ganache</span><span class="pl-c1">Process stopped</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">With the following command, you can start Ganache, run your tests, and stop Ganache when you are finished.</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="GANACHE=$(ganache --detach) && npm run test; ganache instances stop $GANACHE"><pre><span class="pl-c1">GANACHE=$(ganache --detach) && npm run test; ganache instances stop $GANACHE</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Or if you are running PowerShell on Windows, you can do:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-powershell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$GANACHE=ganache --detach; npm run test; ganache instances stop $GANACHE"><pre><span class="pl-smi">$GANACHE</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>ganache <span class="pl-k">--</span>detach; npm run test; ganache instances stop <span class="pl-smi">$GANACHE</span></pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Ganache Provider Events</h3><a id="user-content-ganache-provider-events" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Ganache Provider Events" href="#ganache-provider-events"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">In addition to <a href="https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1193" rel="nofollow">EIP-1193's</a> <code>"message"</code> event and the legacy <code>"data"</code> event, Ganache emits 4 additional events: <code>"ganache:vm:tx:before"</code>, <code>"ganache:vm:tx:step"</code>, <code>"ganache:vm:tx:after"</code>, and <code>"ganache:vm:tx:console.log"</code>.</p><p dir="auto">These events can be used to observe the lifecycle of any transaction executed via <code>*sendTransaction</code>, <code>eth_call</code>, <code>debug_traceTransaction</code>, or <code>debug_storageRangeAt</code>.</p><p dir="auto">These share the <a href="https://www.trufflesuite.com/docs/truffle/advanced/event-system#how-to-define-your-event-handlers" rel="nofollow">event paradigm that Truffle uses</a>, but without any of the wildcard handling, i.e., no <code>"vm:*"</code> support (for now).</p><p dir="auto">Each of these events will emit a <code>context</code> object which is a unique object that can be used to identify a transaction over the course of its lifecycle. For example:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-ts notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="interface StepEvent {  account: {    nonce: bigint;    balance: bigint;    stateRoot: Buffer;    codeHash: Buffer;  };  address: Buffer;  codeAddress: Buffer;  depth: number;  gasLeft: bigint;  gasRefund: bigint;  memory: Buffer;  memoryWordCount: bigint;  opcode: {    name: string;    fee: number;  };  pc: number;  returnStack: Buffer[];  stack: Buffer[];}const contexts = new Map();provider.on("ganache:vm:tx:before", (event: { context: {} }) => {  contexts.set(event.context, []);});provider.on("ganache:vm:tx:step", (event: { context: {}; data: StepEvent }) => {  contexts.get(event.context).push(event.data);});provider.on(  "ganache:vm:tx:console.log",  (event: { context: {}; logs: (string | bigint | boolean)[] }) => {    console.log(...event.logs);  });provider.on("ganache:vm:tx:after", (event: { context: {} }) => { <code>context</code> is necessary is that Ganache may run multiple transactions simultaneously, so <code>"ganache:vm:tx:step"</code> events from different transactions could be intermingled.</p><p dir="auto">The above events will be emitted for <code>eth_call</code>, <code>*sendTransaction</code>, <code>debug_traceTransaction</code>, and <code>debug_storageRangeAt</code>.</p><p dir="auto">Currently, we do not await the event listener's return value, however, we'll likely enable this in the future.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ docker run --detach --publish 8545:8545 trufflesuite/ganache:latest"><pre>$ <span class="pl-s1">docker run --detach --publish 8545:8545 trufflesuite/ganache:latest</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">To pass options to Ganache through Docker simply add the arguments to the end of the run command, e.g.,</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ docker run --detach --publish 8545:8545 trufflesuite/ganache:latest --accounts 10 --debug                                                                      ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^"><pre>$ <span class="pl-s1">docker run --detach --publish 8545:8545 trufflesuite/ganache:latest --accounts 10 --debug</span><span class="pl-c1">                                                                      ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">The Docker container adds an environment variable <code>DOCKER=true</code>; when this variable is set to <code>true</code> (case insensitive), Ganache uses a default hostname IP of <code>0.0.0.0</code> instead of the normal default <code>127.0.0.1</code>. You can still specify a custom hostname however:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ docker run --detach --publish 8545:8545 trufflesuite/ganache:latest --host XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX                                                                      ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^"><pre>$ <span class="pl-s1">docker run --detach --publish 8545:8545 trufflesuite/ganache:latest --host XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX</span><span class="pl-c1">                                                                      ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">To build and run the Docker container from source:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ git clone https://github.com/trufflesuite/ganache.git && cd ganache"><pre>$ <span class="pl-s1">git clone https://github.com/trufflesuite/ganache.git <span class="pl-k">&&</span> <span class="pl-c1">cd</span> ganache</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">then:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-shell-session notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ docker build --tag trufflesuite/ganache --file ./packages/ganache/Dockerfile .$ docker run --publish 8545:8545 trufflesuite/ganache"><pre>$ <span class="pl-s1">docker build --tag trufflesuite/ganache --file ./packages/ganache/Dockerfile <span class="pl-c1">.</span></span>$ <span class="pl-s1">docker run --publish 8545:8545 trufflesuite/ganache</span></pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element"
